answers.answer: Do you have a history of diabetes? Any symptoms of excessive thirst, frequent urination? Do you have any other symptoms such as muscle weakness or difficulty walking?  Tingling of hands and feet occur in many diseases, including diabetic neuropathy, peripheral neuropathy, cervical radiculopathy, etc.  I advise you to go ahead with the EMG and consult a neurologist with the results of the test.

question: I started with tingling and needels like feeling in both of my feet mostly my toes...now its in my arm and wrist and hands ...going for a EMG on Wednesday ..hope its not painful...i am really scared...I think i have something really bad...can anyone help ...thanks Judy
title: Please help anyone
